original:
In the mid-19th century, Robert Remak and Rudolf Virchow contributed significantly to the formulation of the third tenet of cell theory, which, by the 1860s, was widely accepted by biologists. This consolidation of ideas established the foundation of cell theory. Concurrently, taxonomy and classification emerged as primary areas of interest for natural historians.

Carl Linnaeus published a foundational taxonomy of the natural world in
